tool_description:
Checks for fake DNS as well as uses regex functions to check the email for the right length and accepted characters.
For example it will mark as valid an email like 'john@gmail.com' but it will recognize as a fake 'john@gmaill.com' (because of the not existing domain)
name: Email Validator
title: Email Validator

api_list.name: validateEmail
api_list.description: Checks for fake DNS as well as uses regex functions to check the email for the right length and accepted characters.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://pozzad-email-validator.p.rapidapi.com/emailvalidator/validateEmail/john@gmail.com"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "pozzad-email-validator.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://pozzad-email-validator.p.rapidapi.com/emailvalidator/validateEmail/{email}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "pozzad-email-validator.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
